content:
Audit Report No. A-1711
May 16, 1962
CUSA (6)
TO:
Mr. W. C. Haraldson, Director
THRU:
Mr. H. F. Shambarger, Controller
aufunnell
FROM: J. D. Martin, Acting Chief, Audit Branch
Ameter.
SUBJ: Audit Report No. 4-1711 (Initial) Special Investigation on the Arrival and Disposal of Excess Property
I. PURPOSE:
To conduct an investigation to determine if the disposition of excess property is effective and appropriate.
II. SCOPE:
a. Dato: March 2 thru 8, 1962
b. Place visited: 1. Supply/Procurement Branch, PO, US AID/C 2. Second Division, CUSA 3. Third Division, CUSA
4. Accounting Office, CUSA
5. Bureau of Engineering Service (BES)
c. Persons contacted: The responsible personnel of the above offices/organizations were contacted.
III. FINDINGS: 許躍薾
See Attachment I for audit report details
IV. RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. CUSA should reorganize the system of handling the excess property program toprovide satisfactory control of, and accounting for, these commodities.
20
2. CUSA should be roquested to expedite the disposition of long- idlo items.
3D
3. The storage conditions at BES yard should be improved. 2D
4. Excess property should not be sold to traders or individual person unless prior concurrence of the US AID/C is obtained on a case by case basis.
3D
5. Allocation of excess property to non-elligible recipients should be discontinued immediately. Where delivery has not been made, 3D it should be cancelled.
v. REPORT RATING:
Incomplete
VI. REMARKS :
1. This report was cleared by ID, PO and P/SP.
2. Concerning CUSA clearance, see Attachment III-A, III-B, IIT-C and III-D.
Attachments
cc: LA, PO, EP, P/LCM, ID, P/SP, CUSA(6), E/RS

paragraphs.content: FROM: J. D. Martin, Acting Chief, Audit Branch
SUBJ: Audit Report No. 4-1711 (Initial) Special Investigation on the Arrival and Disposal of Excess Property
To conduct an investigation to determine if the disposition of excess property is effective and appropriate.
b. Place visited: 1. Supply/Procurement Branch, PO, US AID/C 2. Second Division, CUSA 3. Third Division, CUSA
c. Persons contacted: The responsible personnel of the above offices/organizations were contacted.
See Attachment I for audit report details
1. CUSA should reorganize the system of handling the excess property program toprovide satisfactory control of, and accounting for, these commodities.
2. CUSA should be roquested to expedite the disposition of long- idlo items.
3. The storage conditions at BES yard should be improved. 2D
4. Excess property should not be sold to traders or individual person unless prior concurrence of the US AID/C is obtained on a case by case basis.
5. Allocation of excess property to non-elligible recipients should be discontinued immediately. Where delivery has not been made, 3D it should be cancelled.
1. This report was cleared by ID, PO and P/SP.
2. Concerning CUSA clearance, see Attachment III-A, III-B, IIT-C and III-D.
cc: LA, PO, EP, P/LCM, ID, P/SP, CUSA(6), E/RS
